commit_message:
Add channel feedback on 'book' command

We suppressed channel feedback for most actions, to keep
it quiet. However for the book action, it's good to show
that the command worked.

Change-Id: I4777ecbc854c3f00a3edf69ad30660ec636d3d37

added_lines: self.send(chan, "%s: Room %s is now booked on %s for %s" % (nick, room, timeslot, track))

commit_message:
Revert "Run with KVM if we can in tests"

The nested virt issues we saw on OVH should be resolved now.
More information here: I980cdbc67d6e7b3a8a2520b2279ff3a1cdf68c4b

This reverts commit 748e3d22925ff9cfe8baba087f37b26988f9e1e0.

Change-Id: If2adfc006ee9efb3f80e23d34311673b7c74d274
(cherry picked from commit a771ef5a03294a6763a38f9c15fec6e983a76b69)

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I10d50d987ec37e45a8af94c15af317a4dbc43f1b
Story: #2002586
Task: #24339

commit_message:
Move to openshift-ansible 3.10

This patch adds a new role called OpenShiftInfra which is required to
define infra nodes. We've been bundling infra nodes with compute and
master nodes and they ought to be independent.

With the new node label management introduced in openshift-ansible, it
sounds like this is a good time for us to unbundle these nodes.

Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I291b6ac65eaa1a015bca2ee2bc1be90b0ea0aadc
Change-Id: I4f8127a9e2d822057f3db8f0974ab1db0698985a

commit_message:
Remove dead code

Now that mox has been removed we can remove the create_stubs
helper function as well.

commit_message:
Add py3-dj21 tox env for Django 2.1

Django 2.1 has been released. It would be nice to have tox env
for testing with Django 2.1.

Note that this does not mean I lead Django 2.1 support.

Related-Bug: #1789046
Change-Id: Ic5f59e3c19480e01f5bfecbb0994121ee649388f

subject: Avoid UnhashableKeyWarning in api.nova.extension_supported
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-05 20:26:06.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/nova.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/f9bb10b945c8b00b345e9169ba7faa5d068382a9', 'message': 'Avoid UnhashableKeyWarning in api.nova.extension_supported

In python3, novaclient ListExtResource is not hashable.
An error message on UnhashableKeyWarning is emitted repeatedly
and this can pollute error log with unuseful messages.

A tuple of extension names are now passed to the memoized
decorator so that the decorator can hash it.

Change-Id: I7f200ee6ece36767586207dc26aed1325b909226
Closes-Bug: #1790930
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid UnhashableKeyWarning in api.nova.extension_supported

In python3, novaclient ListExtResource is not hashable.
An error message on UnhashableKeyWarning is emitted repeatedly
and this can pollute error log with unuseful messages.

A tuple of extension names are now passed to the memoized
decorator so that the decorator can hash it.

Change-Id: I7f200ee6ece36767586207dc26aed1325b909226
Closes-Bug: #1790930
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/04/600204/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(amotoki): In Python 3, a tuple of the Extension classes # is not hashable. The return value must be a known premitive. # This converts the return value to a tuple of a string. def _list_extensions_wrap(request): return tuple(e.name for e in list_extensions(request)) @memoized_with_request(_list_extensions_wrap, 1) def extension_supported(extension_name, supported_ext_names): for ext in supported_ext_names: if ext == extension_name:
deleted_lines: @memoized_with_request(list_extensions, 1) def extension_supported(extension_name, extensions): for extension in extensions: if extension.name == extension_name:

commit_message:
Use atomic package from virt-sig for openshift job

The atomic package in centos extras has conflicts with the
python2-docker package in our master deps. This causes the
openshift job to fail when trying to install the atomic
package. We only add the virt-sig repo to this job, because
it is not mirrored anywhere.

Change-Id: Iaa3f90bd2e9bceb7496e8cb1ab5ce8063ba8c68e

commit_message:
Fix regex for python paunch package in repo config

The paunch package is named python2-paunch or python3-paunch, so we need
to update the regex to python*-paunch* to cover all paunch rpms.

Change-Id: I7d81d1c4af4a6117e45f7fff1fd4edde8ee4d3fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/23/600023/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Quote $PLAYBOOKS variable for sourcing

When $PLAYBOOKS variable is not quoted, it's impossible to source
it from the file because it contains spaces.

Change-Id: I8a8155845e52635d826dabdb5bc02e456b3f2421

commit_message:
Handle sparse resource registry in build_service_filter

During image prepare, the intent of build_service_filter is to filter
out services which are *known* to be not containerized, either because
they are puppet services, or have been mapped to 'OS::Heat::None'.

However if a partial resource registry is passed in, then this was
also filtering out the services with missing resource_registry
mappings. Since we're now assuming services are containerized by
default, this behaviour was cause many of the issues with missing or
no image parameters being generated.

Closes-Bug: #1727347
Change-Id: Ie65038e3ed73a77aeec9178231ab776ed26a2d84
(cherry picked from a26410ff9d32c05d7d59e1594510bf3f154f5f64)

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ie5c081e220763c54e64e5be00714b8dbd0a683f1

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more details information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: Ibdd264f0ef0c27762d47a70da192a858e62074a9

commit_message:
Ceph-storage-init : make configmap and secret names to be driven via chart values

This is make ceph configmap and admin keyring secret names using
in storage init scripts to be read  from chart values as we may
have two ceph clusters  gets activated in one namespace and
each ceph clsuter will have its own configmap and admin secret names.

Change-Id: I84d94f3ac21e602c50619e456ff327ae1da53622

added_lines: import os def get_dir_url(self): """Returns the canonical URL for this workflow. This is used for the POST action attribute on the form element wrapping the workflow. For convenience it defaults to the value of ``request.get_full_path()`` with any query string stripped off, e.g. the path at which the workflow was requested. """ dir_url = self.request.get_full_path() return os.path.dirname(dir_url)

commit_message:
Prevent open redirects on WorkflowView actions

Check that the 'next_url' is resolvable by Django
to prevent malicious links from unexpectedly directing the user to
a different site after a Horizon workflow.

For example:
/admin/flavors/create/?next=http://www.foobar.com/

Change-Id: Iedf70169ee0e5c71bbf8917a77c03860d96b1daf
Closes-Bug: 1625833
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/40/373540/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.utils.http import same_originimport horizon next_url = self.request.POST.get(workflow.redirect_param_name) or workflow.get_success_url() # Prevent open redirects to another site as a result of WorkflowView action # For example: /admin/flavors/create/?next=http://www.foobar.com/ user_home = horizon.get_user_home(request.user) if not same_origin(next_url, user_home): next_url = user_home return shortcuts.redirect(next_url)

commit_message:
Fix `requires_keypair` support

The following patch introduces a few fixes for some problems
that were introduced from previous commits since the introduction
of `transfer-table`.

* Added `tr-change` which allows watching for changes when an
  item is removed or added
* Add validation for key pairs by handling `tr-change` event.

This should help make the migration towards `transfer-table`
much cleaner as there is no way to enforce a minimum item
before this patch.

Change-Id: Ie3d3ba01fc49fc9c141d002bbd87af359cd96545

subject: Allow domain admin to manage own project/user/group correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 11:50:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/e0e1c96cbdea5a421f7d007872b22eeea82966ce', 'message': "Fix so that a domain admin can create/delete users from table action.

At the moment when a user who have a domain admin privilege logged in,
this user cannot create/delete users because of their policy setting.
When we use domain scoped token, we assume that keystone v3 policy file
(policy.v3cloudsample.json) is used.
In this case, some policy like 'delete_user' require 'target' info.
However when we display panel like User panel, target info doesn't exist.
Therefore, policy which is needed some target info will not work correctly.
This patch will address these issues.

Change-Id: I73858c3832ed8841bb72a9210dc6863b7f1bcaaf
Closes-Bug: #1600195

commit_message:
Allow domain admin to manage own project/user/group correctly

At the moment, when a user who have a domain admin privilege logged in,
this user cannot do some operations even though the user has a enough
privilege.
(When we use domain scoped token, we assume that keystone v3
policy file(policy.v3cloudsample.json) is used.)

 - cannot create/delete users(only modify)
 - cannot delete multiple project or group at the same time.
 - cannot modify members in a group

These are caused by not enough target info when policy check is done.
This patch will address these issues.

Change-Id: I73858c3832ed8841bb72a9210dc6863b7f1bcaaf
Closes-Bug: #1600195

commit_message:
Fix server side search

Searching with column always sends list request.
This patch fixed it that send when columns have isServer attribute.

Co-Authored-By: Allen <chen.qiaomin@99cloud.net>

Closes-Bug: #1702833
Change-Id: I5a92af3ad5056343989321ec365829a7c93c5bc0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/86/480886/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

retrieve OS::Nova::Server instead. The Horizon patch shouldn't merge

commit_message:
Use OS::Nova::HostAggregate instead of OS::Nova::Aggregate

The metadata definitions in etc/metadefs allow each namespace to
be associated with a resource type in OpenStack. We realized that
we used OS::Nova::Aggregate instead of OS::Nova::HostAggregate
in Glance. This doesn’t align with Heat or Searchlight.
It should be noted that Heat added the resource type after Glance
had metadefs.

Horizon Issue:

The aggregate update metadata action should retrieve
OS::Nova::HostAggregate instead. The Horizon patch shouldn't merge
until the glance patch merges, but there is not an actual hard
dependency between the two. Horizon may need to request both in
order to be backwards compatible.

Depends-On: Ic6d676fb6a3d91ccfbed56bfad31ab20559a78f5

Closes-Bug:1612491
Change-Id: I5564a9070dc2ebb25ede084033ed16a4c60c4039

commit_message:
Skip flavor's diskcheck when making a volume

When creating a volume from an image during instance launch, the
flavor's disk should not be checked against the image's minimal disk
requirements.

This patch fixes both the angular UI and the traditional Django based
UI.

Closes-bug: #1638581

Change-Id: Ic869cf0bfa5f0666054a916779170de036425602

commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in edit extra spec form

If submit edit extra spec form with empty value, it will raise AttributeError.
Due to the method '_populate_context'  has been redefined and not need to
call again.

Path: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/337703/7/horizon/forms/views.py

Change-Id: Ic131563b47a8bb0b9b7c445b9f312cc57986cece
Closes-bug: #1685822

commit_message:
Clear volume type when creating volume from volume

Creating a volume from another volume will result in an error if the
volume type of the target is set to something other than the volume type
of the source.  This is not normally a problem, but the dialog permits
the user to set the volume type before setting the source, which will
trigger an error if the volume types differ.

Change-Id: I59d9f01698707045bb0e3fdf6446e34511e8b47b
Closes-Bug: 1599225

subject: Add hostname validation in launch instance angularjs panel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-25 13:34:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/ef632e96489ca45e1daa446eb1161fdae3833418', 'message': 'No hostname validation in launch instance angularjs panel

Horizon Juno does not have hostname validation in AngularJS launch instance
form. For example, you can create a new instance with name: "#3rtttt"

That name will cause problems when Nova try to handle, but Horizon allow
launch a new instance with a not valid hostname. A valid hostname is
specified by RFC1123 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1123).

This patch is quite similar to
https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1458800 but the validation
happens in different layers. This patch is needed as Horizon supports
the new AngularJS launch instance form.

Change-Id: I378ba917594a25319cebb623200d0f21b03a7ca5
Closes-Bug: #1490850

commit_message:
Add hostname validation in launch instance angularjs panel

Horizon does not have hostname validation in AngularJS launch instance
form. For example, you can create a new instance with name: "#3rtttt"

That name will cause problems when Nova try to handle, but Horizon allow
launch a new instance with a not valid hostname. A valid hostname is
specified by RFC1123 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1123).

Change-Id: I378ba917594a25319cebb623200d0f21b03a7ca5
Closes-Bug: #1490850

commit_message:
Fix 'Launch Instance' workflow initialization

Using legacy way to launch instance via
'http://horizon_url/project/instances/launch' sometimes wizard is not
loaded properly due to browsers script loading and initialization. This
leads to 'horizon'instances' module is not loaded when we try to use it
from the template's inline script.

Since jQuery is included in the <head> it's safe to use it to wait until
page is loaded and initialize Launch Instance workflow.

Change-Id: Id1599e16ab29748bcd844ec13f9fd0d37e647e58
Related-Bug: #1715066

commit_message:
WEBSSO should not require username/password

As federated login does not use any of the textboxes in the login
screen, these should not be marked as required when anything but
'credentials' is selected.  This solution uses ng-if to remove the
username/password fields from the DOM when federation is selected. This
requires a few workarounds because of the way forms are set up.

A positive side effect of this commit is that it also fixes a small bug
where submit button's label 'Connect' and 'Sign In' would not toggle
when using federation.

Change-Id: Ida0a8a5d23f39bda2ebd8731bf62f9b7d57580dc
Closes-Bug: #1703109

commit_message:
Clarify instance state after launch submission

After submitting a launch instance-workflow, an instance is technically
only scheduled for launch - and not yet actually launched.  This patch
reflects this in the message presented in the top right corner.

Change-Id: I1ae76e026fbb1e95c15d00f983b4eb2468242d76
Closes-bug: #1287051

deleted_lines: var message = ngettext('%s instance launched.', '%s instances launched.', numberInstances);

subject: Makes sure the simulation is advanced only on initial draw
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-13 06:32:11.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/js/horizon.networktopology.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/23aae64bcf6cf6847922c16dc0827e570d214b26', 'message': 'Makes sure the simulation is advanced only on initial draw

When the graph was updated with data synced from the server
(a periodic operation), the D3 simulation was advanced by 100
ticks to set up the graph before being drawn to prevent the
graph from moving around too much when when drawn.

This patch changes this behavior to only happen when the graph
is first being drawn to prevent the graph from being moved
around on every update before being drawn.

Change-Id: Idf62178f7930bb1f02395b7ddadf26147130e9b0
Closes-Bug: 1716834
'}]
commit_message:
Makes sure the simulation is advanced only on initial draw

When the graph was updated with data synced from the server
(a periodic operation), the D3 simulation was advanced by 100
ticks to set up the graph before being drawn to prevent the
graph from moving around too much when when drawn.

This patch changes this behavior to only happen when the graph
is first being drawn to prevent the graph from being moved
around on every update before being drawn.

Change-Id: Idf62178f7930bb1f02395b7ddadf26147130e9b0
Closes-Bug: 1716834
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/39/503539/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: // Tracks if the graph has been previously rendered self.initial_render = true; self.retrieve_network_info(); self.retrieve_network_info(); retrieve_network_info: function() { // If the graph is being rendered for the first time, we want to advance // the simulation a little bit before actually drawing the topology itself // To prevent 'aggressive' rubber banding. if (self.initial_render) { self.initial_render = false;

commit_message:
Disabling debug data for production

AngularJS attaches the scope to the DOM for debugging purposes. Disable
this in production environments. This patch reads from the DEBUG flag
in settings.py and sets the Angular debug mode accordingly.

See https://docs.angularjs.org/guide/production for more information.

As part of this change, we must also adjust code that gets scope objects
from the DOM. Instead, use the $rootScope service.

For example, "angular.element('body').scope()" returns undefined when
Angular debug is turned off. You can use this same line in the browser
console to test if Angular debug mode is enabled or not.

Co-Authored-By: Shaoquan Chen <sean.chen2@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tyr Johansonn <tyr@hpe.com>

Change-Id: Ib529fd4a44767a3a7e78b273332656692f777c8a
Implements: blueprint angular-performance-disabling-debug-data

commit_message:
Creates an interface for user settings

Creates an abstract class (UserSettings) which defines functions for
writing and reading user settings by horizon. Implementations of this
interface may be used to change the storage method used for user settings.

The implementation used to store user settings is selected by setting the
value of USER_SETTINGS_HANDLER in settings.py in the form: module.class.

example: USER_SETTINGS_HANDLER = "horizon.utils.SessionUserSettings"

where SessionUserSettings is a classe extending the abstract UserSettings
class.

If the user setting handling class is not set, a default implementation
us used; this implementation uses the default session and cookie based
system originally implemented in horizon.

Change-Id: I8c6b7472e3f4bacf3169a758ff1a1dcd1282a1c0
Closes-Bug: 1713478
Co-Authored-By: ales.krivak@ultimum.io

added_lines: from .user_settings import get_user_settings_handler def get_page_size(request, default=20): handler = get_user_settings_handler(request) try: page_size = int(handler.get( 'horizon_pagesize', getattr(settings, 'API_RESULT_PAGE_SIZE', default)) ) except ValueError: page_size = int(default) handler.update(horizon_pagesize=page_size) return page_size def get_log_length(request, default=35): handler = get_user_settings_handler(request) try: log_length = int(handler.get( 'instance_log_length', getattr(settings, 'INSTANCE_LOG_LENGTH', default)) ) except ValueError: log_length = int(default) handler.update(instance_log_length=log_length) return log_length
deleted_lines: def get_page_size(request): return get_config_value(request, 'API_RESULT_PAGE_SIZE', 20) def get_log_length(request): return get_config_value(request, 'INSTANCE_LOG_LENGTH', 35)

commit_message:
Remove changeBootSource call

Calling the function in updateBootSourceSelection causes the
selected image to be de-allocated when an instance is being
launched from an image.

Change-Id: I22521865f6fc956094588956ce5c5f4bde8b20c7
Closes-Bug: #1704908

commit_message:
Raise appropriate error if failed to upload image

When creating new image, glance can deny uploading image
because it exceeds the .quota defined in glance-api configuration
file.
This patchi attempts to report this error to a UI user.

Change-Id: I12ba585f9046a632d8b4ad86439e8ff7c6ce0b92
Closes-Bug: #1270817

commit_message:
Enhance Project/Admin Instance tables to page backward

Currently the Project/Admin Instance tables can only page forward.
This patch set is to enhance nova api to support paging backward.

With this patch set, users should see a "Prev" link in the middle or
last page
when they are doing paging.

Change-Id: I458e4d54eca1901f4f49db8738b27d755992ade0
Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>
Closes-Bug: #1274427

added_lines: def server_list(request, search_opts=None, all_tenants=False, handle_page_back=False): # handle previous page has_prev_data = False if handle_page_back and search_opts.get('marker', None) is not None: # First page condition if search_opts.get('sort_dir', 'asc') is 'asc' \ and has_more_data is False: has_more_data = True has_prev_data = False else: # rest conditions has_prev_data = True if not handle_page_back: return (servers, has_more_data) else: return (servers, has_more_data, has_prev_data)
deleted_lines: def server_list(request, search_opts=None, all_tenants=False): return (servers, has_more_data)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 03:17:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/ports/forms.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/fe058e89f8b10180db5fc42c6279134e4f5be3ca', 'message': 'Enabling MAC learning needs to also remove security groups and port security

When MAC learning is enabled, port security must be disabled and security groups
must be removed in most platforms.  Consequently when MAC learning is disabled
port security must be added back to the port.

Change-Id: I1a6f91b382d18b7365e272b97057052ec668aea8
Closes-Bug: #1648011
'}]
commit_message:
Enabling MAC learning needs to also remove security groups and port security

When MAC learning is enabled, port security must be disabled and security groups
must be removed in most platforms.  Consequently when MAC learning is disabled
port security must be added back to the port.

Change-Id: I1a6f91b382d18b7365e272b97057052ec668aea8
Closes-Bug: #1648011
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/94/408394/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If the user is enabling MAC learning, then port security # has to be disabled and security groups have to be removed # in most platforms. If the user is disabling MAC learning # then port security should be re-enabled. if data['mac_state']: extension_kwargs['port_security_enabled'] = False extension_kwargs['security_groups'] = [] else: extension_kwargs['port_security_enabled'] = True

commit_message:
Initalize themable selects only once.

We don't want to reinitialize selects that have already been
initialized.

Closes-bug: #1617001
Change-Id: Ide2c81a52f59f7f736b162e4e3cf31bb68b58b42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/79/360679/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if (!$elem.hasClass('select-initialized')) { $elem.addClass('select-initialized') .on('click', 'li a', function () { var $this = $(this); var $container = $this.closest('.themable-select'); var value = $this.data('selectValue'); // Find select ... if we've searched for it before, then its cached on 'data-select' var $select = $container.data('mySelect'); if (!$select) { $select = $container.find('select'); $container.data('mySelect', $select); } // Set the select if necessary if ($select.val() !== value) { $select.val(value).change(); } }); $elem.find('li a[title]').tooltip(); // We need to rebuild the dropdown if the Select html ever // changes via javascript. Mutation Observers are DOM change // listeners. http://stackoverflow.com/a/11546242 MutationObserver = window.MutationObserver || window.WebKitMutationObserver; // eslint-disable-line no-native-reassign var $targets = $elem.find('select'); for (var ii = 0; ii < $targets.length; ii++) { var observer = new MutationObserver(function (mutations) { // eslint-disable-line no-loop-func // Will return many mutations for a select box changing, // we just need the target of one. var $select = $(mutations[0].target).closest('select'); var $options = $select.find('option'); var list = []; for (var jj = 0; jj < $options.length; jj++) { // Build new list item and anchor tag. var $list_item = $(document.createElement('li')) var $anchor = $(document.createElement('a')); // Append option text to anchor, then to list item. $anchor.text($($options[jj]).text()).appendTo($list_item); list[jj] = $list_item; } // Add the new list to the dropdown. $select.siblings('.dropdown-menu').html(list).change(); }); var config = { childList: true, subtree: true, attributes: false, characterData: true }; observer.observe($targets[ii], config); } // Update the dropdown if select value changes $elem.children('select').on('change', function () { var $this = $(this); var thisVal = $this.val(); var thisLabel = $this.find('option[value="' + thisVal + '"]').text(); // Go find the title element var $title = $this.parents('.themable-select').find('.dropdown-title'); // Set dropdown title to first option if the select menu is unset if (thisLabel === null || thisLabel.length === 0) { thisLabel = $this.find('option').first().text(); } // Update the dropdown-title if necessary. if (thisLabel !== $title.text()) { $title.text(thisLabel); } }

commit_message:
switch documentation job to new PTI

This is a mechanically generated patch to switch the documentation
jobs to use the new PTI versions of the jobs as part of the
python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I94ea2a4ca08edbf7ec2dc4139dd5d93dab6c5180
Story: #2002586
Task: #24760

commit_message:
Add backend for Horizon memcache

Use this backend for Memcached(python-memcached),
instead django-backend. Now, we can set delay to 0sec.
Added memcache-wrapper for extension python-memcache.

Implements: blueprint horizon-memcached
Closes-bug: 1441522
Change-Id: I4131521f82364e800d42bd69806bebb397b27a2e

commit_message:
Switch cinder to usage quotas

This change enables horizon to show cinder usage quotas. The
usage quotas provide both usage and the quota/limit for the
project in a single api, and the usage quotas provide more in
depth information to all the storage backend possibilities.

Co-Authored-By: Brad Pokorny <Brad_Pokorny@symantec.com>

Change-Id: I34203e7aa61f1ee1d91fe2dea44c580a5da675c4
Implements: blueprint horizon-use-quotas-api
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/04/309204/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cinder_limits = {} self.cinder_backends = [] try: # TODO(ducttape) - make this config file driven instead of this cinder_limits, self.cinder_backends = api.cinder.\ tenant_quota_usage_get(self.request, self.project_id) except Exception: try: cinder_limits = api.cinder.tenant_absolute_limits(self.request) except Exception: msg = _("Unable to retrieve volume limit information.") exceptions.handle(self.request, msg) self.limits.update(cinder_limits)
deleted_lines: try: self.limits.update(api.cinder.tenant_absolute_limits(self.request)) except Exception: msg = _("Unable to retrieve volume limit information.") exceptions.handle(self.request, msg)

commit_message:
Modify create/update Project in case that "compute" service is disabled

At the moment, if "compute" service is disabled, quota tab will be hidden
in create/update project. However, when operator create/update project,
quota update error will occur even though operator couldn't see quota
tab. This patch will fix this problem.

Change-Id: I26cd91e1ebbab91fd13d691368987fe414f25edb
Closes-Bug: #1591954
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/47/328947/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, request, *args, **kwargs): super(UpdateProjectGroupsAction, self).__init__(request, *args, **kwargs) project_id = '' if 'project_id' in self.initial: project_id = self.initial['project_id'] # get initial project quota if keystone.is_cloud_admin(self.request): quota_data = quotas.get_tenant_quota_data(self.request, tenant_id=project_id) if api.base.is_service_enabled(self.request, 'network') and \ api.neutron.is_quotas_extension_supported( self.request): quota_data += api.neutron.tenant_quota_get( self.request, tenant_id=project_id) for field_name in quotas.QUOTA_FIELDS: self.fields[field_name] = quota_data.get(field_name).limit # Update quota when steps have a quota tab for step in self.steps: if step.slug == 'create_quotas': self._update_project_quota(request, data, project_id) break # Update quota when steps have a quota tab has_quota_tab = False for step in self.steps: if step.slug == 'update_quotas': has_quota_tab = True break if has_quota_tab: ret = self._update_project_quota(request, data, project_id) if not ret: return False else: return True
deleted_lines: self._update_project_quota(request, data, project_id) ret = self._update_project_quota(request, data, project_id) if not ret: return False

subject: Update NG toast service to use HORIZON_CONFIG's auto_fade_alerts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-14 17:53:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/fceeb251fe271010842998cba86b6a5c5c3103ba', 'message': "Update NG toast service to use HORIZON_CONFIG's auto_fade_alerts

Retrieve the HORIZON_CONFIG auto_fade_alerts setting from local_settings.py
for the Angular toast service to use

Remove from conf.js (so we can remove it after Diana's spinner
patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/313685/ and this patch get merged)

Test it out by copying the changes from local_settings.py.example,
setting your alert fade delay to something like 100/10000 (default is 3000)
and see how it affects a toast.

Change-Id: Ia69d70665e1989a4f4b441da463a2ee36ed5d01f
Closes-Bug: #1602857

commit_message:
Update NG toast service to use HORIZON_CONFIG's auto_fade_alerts

Retrieve the HORIZON_CONFIG auto_fade_alerts setting from settings
for the Angular toast service to use

Remove from conf.js (so we can remove it after Diana's spinner
patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/313685/ and this patch get merged)

Test it out by copying the changes from local_settings.py.example,
setting your alert fade delay to something like 100/10000 (default is 3000)
and see how it affects a toast.

Change-Id: Ia69d70665e1989a4f4b441da463a2ee36ed5d01f
Closes-Bug: #1602857

commit_message:
Volume Type Extra Spec key-value creation doesn't validate blank spaces

Added validation to check if empty values are entered in key and values fields
Thrown error if given empty.

Change-Id: I79943d53d53bd1b6fa13b8402b700e5d567a20f3
Closes-Bug: #1608351
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/68/364768/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def clean_key(self): cleaned_key = self.cleaned_data['key'] if len(cleaned_key.strip()) == 0: msg = _('Key field cannot be empty.') self._errors['key'] = self.error_class([msg]) return cleaned_key def clean_value(self): cleaned_value = self.cleaned_data['value'] if len(cleaned_value.strip()) == 0: msg = _('Value field cannot be empty.') self._errors['value'] = self.error_class([msg]) return cleaned_value

commit_message:
Fixed the Volume Type and QoS specs table size issues

The Admin Volume Types and QoS Specs tables appear to be squished.
This can seen by right clicking on either Volume Types --> "View
Extra Specs" or QoS Specs --> "Manage Specs" actions and opening
the link in a new tab/page.  The issue I found was that the
'index.html' pages for these two resources was including the
'_index.html'page, which extends the modal form and thus squishes
the table to modal size.  To solve this issue, I simply removed the
include of the '_index.html" pages and just rendered the table in
the index file itself.  The tables are now full width and look as
they should.

Change-Id: I23851c50fcfed0ec082bf669ff89c989758b86cf
Closes-Bug: #1525410

commit_message:
Modified form of creating volume from a snapshot submit behavior.

Currently, when creating volume from a snapshot, you will get a
mismatched form after an invalid submission.

This change adds post function to volume create interface form.
allowing user to go back into the form after an invalid submission.

Change-Id: I686e49b7650953348fce98f735ac80b0dd369b94
Closes-Bug: 1642910

added_lines: from django.utils.http import urlencode submit_url = "horizon:project:volumes:volumes:create" self.submit_url = reverse(self.submit_url) params = None if "snapshot_id" in self.request.GET: snapshot_id = self.request.GET['snapshot_id'] params = urlencode({"snapshot_id": snapshot_id}) if params: self.submit_url = "?".join([self.submit_url, params])

commit_message:
merge "Edit Host Aggregate" and "Manage Hosts" into one tabbed modal

As mentioned in Bug #1290618, the behavior of these two table row
actions was inconsistent with other panels.
1. This patch corrects the UX, makes the two actions focus on the
   different tab in one workflow modal.
2. To follow out DRY, some refactories are applied to reuse the code and
   template in create aggregate workflow.
3. The corresponding unit tests are adjusted to fit this change.

Change-Id: Icaed4c217c316a2605b30ef22e1ce533feeccbda
Closes-Bug: #1290618

added_lines: from django.http import HttpResponse import jsonfrom horizon import viewsclass GetAggregateHosts(views.APIView): def get(self, request): name = self.request.GET.get('name', '') aggregates_names = [] try: aggregates = api.nova.aggregate_details_list(self.request) except Exception: msg = _('Unable to get host aggregate list') exceptions.check_message(["Connection", "refused"], msg) if aggregates is not None: for aggregate in aggregates: aggregates_names.append(aggregate.name) return HttpResponse(json.dumps(aggregates_names))

commit_message:
Added support for tenant metadata

Metadata modal and sevice updated to handle keystone project metadata.
Metadata is stored as a serialized json in tenant's description field.
Metadata overwrites existing description.

Change-Id: I532b8a556cb07a4d5d562d116c17a252808e4178
Implements:blueprint ability-to-add-metadata-to-keystone-projects
Co-Authored-By: Nikita Konovalov <nkonovalov@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Networks panel can't be actually disabled

  1.Disabling networks panel in Project,admin networks panel should work.
  2.Maintained common templates used by both Project and Admin separately.
  3.Templates path horizon/openstack_dashboard/templates/networks/

This patch is taken from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408583/

Change-Id: I1fa4a223bf45ca668824951ac55eb706718de4c3
Closes-Bug: #1321865

commit_message:
Fix User logged out when switch a project with non-admin role.
This fixes the problem now and there are still some problems in
using angular partly. An angular solution is in need
when the route system completely uses angular.
Closes-Bug: #1678204

Change-Id: I76f493cda4bd0503a19eaaf183ed09ed228d417c

commit_message:
Allocation FIP: Pool without IPv4 subnet is shown in the FIP pool list

Pools without ipv4 subnets are shown in the pool list. To hide them,
check if the pool's subnets returened in floating_ips/views.py
includes ipv4 subnet before appending the pool to the list.

Change-Id: I53fb936515913e298a772adfd14046dbe6e68a5c
Closes-Bug: #1689011

subject: Allow reassociate for associated FIPs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-22 19:48:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/aa4820e576d8fb499e17508a1cde37d725b47c2b', 'message': 'Allow reassociate for associated FIPs

Change-Id: Ib842a50c0a2933fb6fd63661e58415064290c138
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-23 00:55:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/2cee9cd93468f0159b414e8c1402e8d8dbcd5c7a', 'message': "Allow reassociate for associated FIPs

The Compute -> Access & Security -> Floating IPs tab should provide
the Associate button for FIPs that are already associated.
The nova CLI allows a user to associate an already associated FIP,
with the behavior being that the FIP is transferred from one VM to another.

A single API call to nova associates the IP with the new VM and
disassociates it from the old VM. The CLI behavior is especially
useful for service IP's, where switching an IP from one VM to
another quickly is important.

Closes-Bug: #1518134

Change-Id: Ib842a50c0a2933fb6fd63661e58415064290c138
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-23 04:30:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/aed6d41de6a0db0274da9e3bca215c6710075539', 'message': "Allow reassociate for associated FIPs

The Compute -> Access & Security -> Floating IPs tab should provide
the Associate button for FIPs that are already associated.
The nova CLI allows a user to associate an already associated FIP,
with the behavior being that the FIP is transferred from one VM to another.

A single API call to nova associates the IP with the new VM and
disassociates it from the old VM. The CLI behavior is especially
useful for service IP's, where switching an IP from one VM to
another quickly is important.

Closes-Bug: #1518134

Change-Id: Ib842a50c0a2933fb6fd63661e58415064290c138

commit_message:
Allow reassociate for associated FIPs

The Compute -> Access & Security -> Floating IPs tab should provide
the Associate button for FIPs that are already associated.
The nova CLI allows a user to associate an already associated FIP,
with the behavior being that the FIP is transferred from one VM to another.

A single API call to nova associates the IP with the new VM and
disassociates it from the old VM. The CLI behavior is especially
useful for service IP's, where switching an IP from one VM to
another quickly is important.

Closes-Bug: #1518134

Change-Id: Ib842a50c0a2933fb6fd63661e58415064290c138
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/23/283223/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ReassociateIP(tables.LinkAction): name = "resassociate" verbose_name = _("Reassociate") classes = ("ajax-modal",) url = "horizon:project:access_and_security:floating_ips:associate" icon = "link" def allowed(self, request, fip): if api.base.is_service_enabled(request, "network"): policy = (("network", "update_floatingip"),) else: policy = (("compute", "compute_extension:floating_ips"), ("compute", "network:disassociate_floating_ip"),) return fip.port_id and POLICY_CHECK(policy, request) def get_link_url(self, datum): base_url = reverse(self.url) params = urlencode({"ip_id": self.table.get_object_id(datum)}) return "?".join([base_url, params]) row_actions = (AssociateIP, DisassociateIP, ReleaseIPs, ReassociateIP)

commit_message:
Instances column is shortened so it fits properly

The 'Time since created' column name has been shortened to 'Age'
in project instances and admin instances meaning it fits properly
in table header cell and doesn't cause table header height to
increase

closes bug: #1614287

Change-Id: I960988bef684af5621ee52b3a13911755f7f25b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/04/535004/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set admin password for instance in Angular

Now we can't set admin password for instance in angular form, this
patch fixed this.

Change-Id: Id1d636fd6dd63945f1cd3755120fb63a50027c9d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/55/501055/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ctrl.adminPassError = gettext('Confirm admin password must be same as admin password');

subject: Refactors network topology (GRAPH) into angular elements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-13 07:36:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/794e00c014bae9f6f7804b8e1ecba53ea8397e28', 'message': "Refactors network topology into angular elements

IMPORTANT: This is still WIP, but the general outline is
there. For review/debug/testing:

- settings.ANGULAR_TOPOLOGY = True enables the feature as
  a new tab in the network topology panel
- settings.ANGULAR_DEBUG_MODEL = True enables a model
  debugging UI instead of using live server data

NOTE: A series of debug components exist for
development and are not meant for the final version
of this patch.

Visualisation is divided into separate compoments:

- Network-topology serves as the central component tying
  all of the functionality together
- Topology-graph wraps D3 displaying code. It should
  be as general (and generic) as possible for potential
  reuse in different contexts
- Popup-balloon contains the logic related to the popups
  displayed when clicking individual nodes in the graph
- button-bar and checkbox-button are utility components
  used in the UI

In addition to the visualisation elements, data handling
has also been refactored and moved into angular elements:

- Topology-model.service contains code which handles the
  reception of data from the server, it's mapping and
  comparison with cached data for full diffing support
  (data is modified, deleted and created on synch).

  This service is meant as the central model store
  (Single source of truth). This data store should
  never be modified outside of the server synching
  mechanism; any components that need to modify data
  should create local working copies (data immutability).

- Topology-graph.factory is the factory function that
  takes the stored model data and creates a graph-like
  data structure of nodes and edges which are then
  used for D3 display.

  These elements are bound as D3 data when displayed.
  Any purely visual operations
  (Network Collapsing) should be carried out
  at this level, NOT at the model level.

Intended as a continuation of the work done in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/199063/

Change-Id: I88bc057d2e34e2a683b0c494530b19c8d560cd86
Implements: blueprint curvature-network-topology

IMPORTANT: This is still WIP, but the general outline is
there. For review/debug/testing:

- settings.ANGULAR_TOPOLOGY = True enables the feature as
  a new tab in the network topology panel
- settings.ANGULAR_DEBUG_MODEL = True enables a model
  debugging UI instead of using live server data

NOTE: A series of debug components exist for
development and are not meant for the final version
of this patch.

Visualisation is divided into separate compoments:

- Network-topology serves as the central component tying
  all of the functionality together
- Topology-graph wraps D3 displaying code. It should
  be as general (and generic) as possible for potential
  reuse in different contexts
- Popup-balloon contains the logic related to the popups
  displayed when clicking individual nodes in the graph
- button-bar and checkbox-button are utility components
  used in the UI

In addition to the visualisation elements, data handling
has also been refactored and moved into angular elements:

- Topology-model.service contains code which handles the
  reception of data from the server, it's mapping and
  comparison with cached data for full diffing support
  (data is modified, deleted and created on synch).

  This service is meant as the central model store
  (Single source of truth). This data store should
  never be modified outside of the server synching
  mechanism; any components that need to modify data
  should create local working copies (data immutability).

- Topology-graph.factory is the factory function that
  takes the stored model data and creates a graph-like
  data structure of nodes and edges which are then
  used for D3 display.

  These elements are bound as D3 data when displayed.
  Any purely visual operations
  (Network Collapsing) should be carried out
  at this level, NOT at the model level.

Intended as a continuation of the work done in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/199063/

Change-Id: I88bc057d2e34e2a683b0c494530b19c8d560cd86

commit_message:
Refactors network topology (GRAPH) into angular elements

IMPORTANT: This is still WIP, but the general outline is
there. For review/debug/testing:

- settings.ANGULAR_TOPOLOGY = True enables the feature as
  a new tab in the network topology panel
- settings.ANGULAR_DEBUG_MODEL = True enables a model
  debugging UI instead of using live server data

NOTE: A series of debug components exist for
development and are not meant for the final version
of this patch.

Visualisation is divided into separate compoments:

- Network-topology serves as the central component tying
  all of the functionality together
- Topology-graph wraps D3 displaying code. It should
  be as general (and generic) as possible for potential
  reuse in different contexts
- Popup-balloon contains the logic related to the popups
  displayed when clicking individual nodes in the graph
- button-bar and checkbox-button are utility components
  used in the UI

In addition to the visualisation elements, data handling
has also been refactored and moved into angular elements:

- Topology-model.service contains code which handles the
  reception of data from the server, it's mapping and
  comparison with cached data for full diffing support
  (data is modified, deleted and created on synch).

  This service is meant as the central model store
  (Single source of truth). This data store should
  never be modified outside of the server synching
  mechanism; any components that need to modify data
  should create local working copies (data immutability).

- Topology-graph.factory is the factory function that
  takes the stored model data and creates a graph-like
  data structure of nodes and edges which are then
  used for D3 display.

  These elements are bound as D3 data when displayed.
  Any purely visual operations
  (Network Collapsing) should be carried out
  at this level, NOT at the model level.

Intended as a continuation of the work done in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/199063/

Change-Id: I88bc057d2e34e2a683b0c494530b19c8d560cd86
Implements: blueprint angular-network-topology

added_lines: (function() { 'use strict'; angular .module('horizon.dashboard.project.debug-model') .component('debugPorts', { bindings: { ports: '<', servers: '<', routers: '<', networks: '<' }, controller: ctrl, templateUrl: templateUrl }); ctrl.$inject = ['$scope']; function ctrl($scope) { var $ctrl = this; // collection for use in UI $ctrl.subnets = []; $scope.$watch( function() { return $.map($ctrl.networks, function(net){ return net.subnets; }) }, function(new_value) { $ctrl.subnets = new_value; }, true ); $ctrl.$onInit = function() { $ctrl.counter = 0; $ctrl.archetype = { "status":"active", "network_id":"", "original_status":"ACTIVE", "url":"seznam.cz", "device_owner":"network:ha_router_replicated_interface", "fixed_ips":[], "id":"", "device_id":"" }; $ctrl.model = $.extend({}, $ctrl.archetype); $ctrl.model.fixed_ips = []; $ctrl.model.id = "p" + $ctrl.counter; ++$ctrl.counter; $ctrl.openModel = false; $ctrl.open = $.map($ctrl.ports, function(ports) { return false; }) }; $ctrl.unCollapse = function(type, index) { if(index == "new") { $ctrl.openModel = !$ctrl.openModel; } else { $ctrl.open[index] = !$ctrl.open[index]; } }; $ctrl.add = function() { $ctrl.ports.push($ctrl.model); $ctrl.model = $.extend({}, $ctrl.archetype); $ctrl.model.fixed_ips = []; $ctrl.model.id = "p" + $ctrl.counter; ++$ctrl.counter; $ctrl.open.push(false); }; $ctrl.delete = function($index) { $ctrl.ports.splice($index, 1); $ctrl.open.splice($index, 1); }; } templateUrl.$inject=['horizon.dashboard.project.basePath']; function templateUrl(basePath) { return basePath + "network-topology/debug-model/debug-ports.html" } })();

commit_message:
Use ctrl.resourceType rather than hardcode

We defined ctrl.resourceType in controller, but we use hardcode
"OS::Neutron::QoSPolicy" in html file, use ctrl.resourceType will
be more resonable.

https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/network_qos/details/overview.controller.js

Change-Id: I72a9fd7dc0fa3c493807f784cb1d1f1bac1ea34c

commit_message:
Fix the 409 error for confirm/revert resize instance

Because of the row_class UpdateRow,If the line of instances table refresh
the state and the instance did not complete resize,we can continue to click
to confirm or revert resize and the nova will be throw the Conflict error.

Change-Id: I1e10ececde84b7d8cf9d2022cd547af616730da8
Closes-Bug: #1732320

added_lines: try: api.nova.server_confirm_resize(request, instance) except Exception: return try: api.nova.server_revert_resize(request, instance) except Exception: return

commit_message:
Remove overlapping network in add interface.

This patch remove all overlaping netowrk in add Interface
panel.

Change-Id: I2009a584148c25642c9795877d9eaaf6718a931d
Closes-Bug: #1746533
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/65/540765/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import netaddr router_subnets = [sub['cidr']for n in networks for sub in n['subnets'] if sub['id'] in router_subnet_ids] match1 = [] match2 = [] for sub in router_subnets: ipnet = netaddr.IPNetwork(sub) for subnet in n['subnets']: new_ipnet = netaddr.IPNetwork(subnet.cidr) match1 += netaddr.all_matching_cidrs(new_ipnet, [sub]) match2 += netaddr.all_matching_cidrs(ipnet, [subnet.cidr]) if not (match1 or match2): net_name = n.name + ': ' if n.name else '' choices += [(subnet.id, '%s%s (%s)' % (net_name, subnet.cidr, subnet.name or subnet.id)) for subnet in n['subnets'] if subnet.id not in router_subnet_ids and subnet.gateway_ip]
deleted_lines: net_name = n.name + ': ' if n.name else '' choices += [(subnet.id, '%s%s (%s)' % (net_name, subnet.cidr, subnet.name or subnet.id)) for subnet in n['subnets'] if subnet.id not in router_subnet_ids and subnet.gateway_ip]

commit_message:
Horizon dashboard now uses oslo-log

Moving from default Python logging module to oslo-log

Change-Id: I071713db399fbb8d7d0831fed0fbbce9e38b16c1
Partial-implements: blueprint horizon-oslo-log
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/96/565796/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import log as logging

Meanwhile, "View Instance Details" link has been changed to

Closes-Bug: 1723142

commit_message:
Drop the "Open Console" link from the instance's ballon

As the call for a console link is a very expensive operation.
Sequentially getting links of all valid instances takes a lot
of computation time. So we decide to remove the "Open Console"
link in the network topology page.

Meanwhile, "View Instance Details" link has been changed to
be opened in a new window/tab. Where you could easily find
the console tab of the instance.

Change-Id: I8af55508026d8e247c40248486bb1ae0015cf460
Closes-Bug: 1723142
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/04/518104/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from openstack_dashboard.dashboards.project.instances import\ console as i_console# List of known server statuses that wont connect to the console console_invalid_status = { 'shutoff', 'suspended', 'resize', 'verify_resize', 'revert_resize', 'migrating', 'build', 'shelved', 'shelved_offloaded'} # Avoid doing extra calls for console if the server is in # a invalid status for console connection if server.status.lower() not in console_invalid_status: try: console = i_console.get_console( request, console_type, server)[0].lower() server_data['console'] = console except exceptions.NotAvailable: pass

subject: Do not redirect to the /identity tab admin users on login.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-23 18:31:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/views.py', 'releasenotes/notes/admin-redirect-on-login-6a818fe886621a14.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/70d563ff80c146869d5cd273a36f14a2fd6ffdc7', 'message': 'Do not redirect to the /identity tab admin users on login.

The /identity url may have more resources than project page so it loads slowly.
We can improve user experience by setting different login url.

Change-Id: I6ce91974d101d80e9685826dc4e6a6495e6a5da3
Closes-Bug: #1778006
(cherry picked from commit 9b6b559eca9822fa887f7cac6b051be126c1d22f)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not redirect to the /identity tab admin users on login.

The /identity url may have more resources than project page so it loads slowly.
We can improve user experience by setting different login url.

Change-Id: I6ce91974d101d80e9685826dc4e6a6495e6a5da3
Closes-Bug: #1778006
(cherry picked from commit 9b6b559eca9822fa887f7cac6b051be126c1d22f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/96/584996/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Do not redirect to the /identity tab admin users on login. Now `user_home` config options works in the same way for all users. [`bug/1778006 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/1778006>`_]

subject: Legacy Transfer Table should inherit from theme
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-08 21:39:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/3a0c79c8f3361706fb5e3fa74f5174cd6821da14', 'message': 'Legacy Transfer Table is now themable.

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-11 19:25:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/1b2ba15341f5e7664518d6859f417ec54496f3e4', 'message': 'Legacy Transfer Table is now themable.

Change-Id: Ie32d591816c4988011fcd634a85df919e0cb12e2
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-12 22:30:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/abca1c9fa36a0c40830d216c35940f2db5e5a651', 'message': 'Legacy Transfer Table is now themable.

The legacy transfer table (the membership table) was being using in
the update member dialog of the identity/projects panel was using
a lot of hardcoded styles.  A fake-table was implemented to help with
layout, but was actually unnecessary, since Bootstrap list groups are
the perfect UI widget for this experience.  Replaced a LOT of custom
scss/html with standard Bootstrap (rows, columns, list groups).

It proved to be difficult to augment any of the markup because the
JavaScript was relying on very very specific markup.  This was
corrected and the JavaScript was also updated to make use of caching
selectors.  Much of the overcomplicated logic (adding styling, etc)
was cleaned up.

Admin -> System -> Metadata Definitions -> Update Associations was
relying on this old styling.  This template was also updated to use
standard Bootstrap markup.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards

Change-Id: Ie32d591816c4988011fcd634a85df919e0cb12e2

'}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2016-05-20 22:16:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/775b47a5741bb95dd84a13fd9067c5a6faa451cf', 'message': 'Legacy Transfer Table should inherit from theme

The legacy transfer table (the membership table) was being using in
the update member dialog of the identity/projects panel was using
a lot of hardcoded styles.  A fake-table was implemented to help with
layout, but was actually unnecessary, since Bootstrap list groups are
the perfect UI widget for this experience.  Replaced a LOT of custom
scss/html with standard Bootstrap (rows, columns, list groups).

It proved to be difficult to augment any of the markup because the
JavaScript was relying on very very specific markup.  This was
corrected and the JavaScript was also updated to make use of caching
selectors.  Much of the overcomplicated logic (adding styling, etc)
was cleaned up.

Admin -> System -> Metadata Definitions -> Update Associations was
relying on this old styling.  This template was also updated to use
standard Bootstrap markup.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards

commit_message:
Legacy Transfer Table should inherit from theme

The legacy transfer table (the membership table) was being using in
the update member dialog of the identity/projects panel was using
a lot of hardcoded styles.  A fake-table was implemented to help with
layout, but was actually unnecessary, since Bootstrap list groups are
the perfect UI widget for this experience.  Replaced a LOT of custom
scss/html with standard Bootstrap (rows, columns, list groups).

It proved to be difficult to augment any of the markup because the
JavaScript was relying on very very specific markup.  This was
corrected and the JavaScript was also updated to make use of caching
selectors.  Much of the overcomplicated logic (adding styling, etc)
was cleaned up.

Admin -> System -> Metadata Definitions -> Update Associations was
relying on this old styling.  This template was also updated to use
standard Bootstrap markup.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards

Change-Id: Ie32d591816c4988011fcd634a85df919e0cb12e2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/25/303625/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /* Transfer Table widget UI */ .transfer-tbl { .dropdown-toggle.btn { @extend .btn-sm; } &-filter-container, &-title { width: 100%; } &-toggle.btn { &, &:hover, &.active, &:active, &:focus { padding: 0 $padding-small-horizontal; font-size: $font-size-large; border: none; box-shadow: none; background: none; color: $brand-primary; } } }

commit_message:
Horizon now uses oslo-log

Moving from default Python logging module to oslo-log

Change-Id: Ic97e57769a3625356a80a8a9dedba0cb31410acd
Partial-implements: blueprint horizon-oslo-log
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/98/565798/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import log as logging

commit_message:
Retrieve password when the key is protected

When the private key is crypted with a passphrase, horizon is unable to decrypt
it.
A new input has been added to the form and with the jsrsasign lib, the private
key can be read and used to decript the VM's password
Closes-Bug: #1632353

Change-Id: I6866973e4a6b1548b50c63d0bad132adb6bfb80a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/91/571491/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ic86f06aa22934bcc7442dbdf9e2e27169d1ecaf2
Story: #2002586
Task: #24760

commit_message:
Fix the stable queens ci test failed

1. What is the problem?

we need move quees to run with the python3. so we can

update from queens. but right now the queens ci can

not pass.

2. What is the solution to the problem?

fix the ci test errors.

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?

No new features.

Change-Id: I2668651004e2dfec854b66c21aebf3269f34161e

commit_message:
OCP-Router - Fix Ingress controller LB listener creation

After the changes done at LBaaS driver to support
namespace network isolation Ingress controller fails to
create/ensure Listener for the L7 Router LB.

This patch fixes this issue, and also update ingress controller
code to retrieve L7 router's LB details in the context of
the working thread.

Closes-Bug: 1787883

Change-Id: Ia63785bdc9018f8ecd3ad820bb484f34c48e9569

commit_message:
PodVIFDriver impl - fix release_vif() signature

Some of the implementations of PodVIFDriver do not have the project_id
and security_groups parameters, resulting in runtime exceptions if these
drivers are used with handlers that expect base class signature to be
followed.

Change-Id: Id1972e02f71238771062cdebec37a3a8a22d768b
Closes-Bug: 1787918
Signed-off-by: Yash Gupta <y.gupta@samsung.com>

subject: Avoid release_vif race when using namespaces and pools
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-20 13:36:35.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_kubernetes/controller/handlers/vif.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/commit/e3a33599a3a3657affdf64ce6c38cd4707158628', 'message': 'Avoid release_vif race when using namespaces and pools

If ports pools and namespace isolation features are enabled together
it may happen that namespace object gets deleted before the vif handler
on_delete function gets executed, leading to a ResourceNotReady
exception raised by the namespace security group driver when trying
to get the kuryrnet crd annotated on the (deleted) namespace object.

This patch ensure if that happens, the vif handler can still complete
the on_deleted function, releasing the vif by using an empty security
group list as the ports are going to be deleted anyway with the rest
of the namespace related OpenStack resources.

Closes-Bug: 1787951
Change-Id: I19a8f89fb13de1b43e2f6178b6b0261f5dde7990
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid release_vif race when using namespaces and pools

If ports pools and namespace isolation features are enabled together
it may happen that namespace object gets deleted before the vif handler
on_delete function gets executed, leading to a ResourceNotReady
exception raised by the namespace security group driver when trying
to get the kuryrnet crd annotated on the (deleted) namespace object.

This patch ensure if that happens, the vif handler can still complete
the on_deleted function, releasing the vif by using an empty security
group list as the ports are going to be deleted anyway with the rest
of the namespace related OpenStack resources.

Closes-Bug: 1787951
Change-Id: I19a8f89fb13de1b43e2f6178b6b0261f5dde7990
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/19/593619/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: security_groups = self._drv_sg.get_security_groups(pod, project_id) except k_exc.ResourceNotReady: # NOTE(ltomasbo): If the namespace object gets deleted first the # namespace security group driver will raise a ResourceNotReady # exception as it cannot access anymore the kuryrnet CRD annotated # on the namespace object. In such case we set security groups to # empty list so that if pools are enabled they will be properly # released. security_groups = []

subject: Ensure ports pool are not duplicated with kuryr-controller HA
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-20 15:54:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/commit/86dbd21b818d442917e57546cb026e5e17218ffc', 'message': 'Ensure ports pool are not duplicated with kuryr-controller HA

Due to ports pool being on kuryr-controller memory, there is a need
for sync-ing the pools when a kuryr-controller becomes the active
controller, otherwise pools created by the previous active controller
will not be used and new ports will be created. This patch ensures
the kuryr-controller triggers a ports pool recovery action when
transitioning to the active controller

TODO:
- Add tests

commit_message:
Ensure ports pool are not duplicated with kuryr-controller HA

Due to ports pool being on kuryr-controller memory, there is a need
for sync-ing the pools when a kuryr-controller becomes the active
controller, otherwise pools created by the previous active controller
will not be used and new ports will be created. This patch ensures
the kuryr-controller triggers a ports pool recovery action when
transitioning to the active controller

Closes-Bug: 1787595
Change-Id: I8ee48f8cf4afad2338ae7a3b55b99ce46910ad70
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/79/593679/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def sync_pools(self): pass def sync_pools(self): # NOTE(ltomasbo): Ensure previously created ports are recovered into # their respective pools self._recover_precreated_ports() def sync_pools(self): for vif_drv in self._vif_drvs.values(): vif_drv.sync_pools()

commit_message:
Remove use_mox directive

As of horizon 14.0.0.0b2 or later the use_mox directive is unecessary
so we can remove it.

Additionally:
* Drop mox3 from test-requirements.txt
* raise lower bound for Horizon (due to mox3 removal)

Change-Id: Ibcdd5fcda789a4038a538b19d09bc87cdc6fe7f3
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Change neutron grafana dashboard to 2-column format

The new layout for the Neutron grafana dashboard expresses results in
sets of two: first the rate of failure, then the number of jobs.  But
the display we had been using was formatted for 3 columns, which meant
things did not line up.  I experimented using the "older release"
neutron dashboards with increasing the span from 4 to 6, which resizes
from three columns to 2.  This means that all of the failure rate graphs
are in one column, and all the job count graphs are in a second column,
for easy comparison.  This change implements the 2-column format for the
main neutron dashboard.

Here are links so you can compare the format:

Main dashboard: http://grafana.openstack.org/d/Hj5IHcSmz/neutron-failure-rate?orgId=1
Older dashboard: http://grafana.openstack.org/d/pM54U-Kiz/neutron-failure-rate-previous-stable-release?orgId=1

Change-Id: I51d7f9ae895cf7ef4caace5a74cf66f78e3581cf

commit_message:
Fix a failure to format config sample

A help string of 'enable_consoleauth' is missing
in nova/conf/workarounds.py.
So formatting sample for enable_consoleauth is failed.

This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Iad799099028f15948733451556207e7a77c1517b
Closes-Bug: #1789800

commit_message:
Remove useless parameter default_flavor

Default flavor to use for the EC2 API only.
The Nova API does not support a default flavor.

Change-Id: Ic731fe84d650fa60be5f2cad4af580446dbb79af

commit_message:
Remove os_compute_api:os-config-drive

Nova API extension concept has been removed in Pike. Those
extensions have their own policies enforcement. As there is
no extensions now, "os_compute_api:os-config-drive"
policy which was added for extensions is not needed any more.

Change-Id: Id112196edcf632c4c67d4b5a431d01107ce7c9da

commit_message:
Added tests for the ssh action

Check two cases:
* access with wrong credentials
* access with correct credentials. The user is created during
`run_tests.sh` execution.

Change-Id: Icbe611d1bff58a1cbfae09bffe6113c3fe5f6804
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

commit_message:
Doc: PowerVM does support shelve

Corrects the support matrix to indicate that PowerVM supports
shelve/unshelve. Shelve only requires a driver to support power_off
and snapshot, both of which the PowerVM driver has implemented.

Change-Id: Iec56a2a61e90d3d97468b1d7f72a0b28975e6cd1

commit_message:
Fix incorrect log resources querying

This patch aims to fix a co-existence problem between security_group
and firewall_group log resources due to incorrect log querying from
database.

Change-Id: Ic60ad436e0fbb23cdae0e63eaeb73130ebf02089
Closes-Bug: #1787119
(Cherry-picked from commit 310bfa326fb9c016d02f9a505ae309ae0e15e7d4)

commit_message:
Import legacy jobs

Import legacy jobs from openstack-zuul-jobs and rename them
following naming policy.

Remove swift legacy jobs, use the new swift-dsvm-functional jobs instead.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/600152

commit_message:
Don't use '_TransactionContextManager._async'

In commit 2d532963, all instances of 'async' were replaced with 'async_'
in preparation for Python 3.7. However, one of these should not have
been changed as it refers to an oslo.db object attribute. That attribute
has actually been renamed itself but that rename is only present from
oslo.db 4.40.0 [1]. Thankfully, an alias to the older name is provided
so we use that.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/commit/df6bf34

Change-Id: I1afd0ba34a9ebcb63edb91e880ef60580befb32e
Closes-Bug: #1788833
(cherry picked from commit bd7d991309ea2bea5d175cb1f2710519936fd0c2)

commit_message:
Update agent/driver API

The update includes region/function IDs, to enable
creation of traits in the future.

Also, extract class methods from FPGADriver class
into a factory class.

Change-Id: I075619d342f8d9764df8ac21f328fef09fe48cac

commit_message:
Fix regex for python paunch package in repo config

The paunch package is named python2-paunch or python3-paunch, so we need to
update the regex to python*-paunch* to cover all paunch rpms.

Change-Id: Icc0dbcdb6ac5150b4187f9d1fa651e3bb9c54355
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-repos refs/changes/24/600024/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'puppet-*,python*-tripleo-common,python*-paunch*')

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-08 14:10:27.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/watcher-dashboard/commit/3e673a26dfda1fe5fa44784c52f14739b0b26818', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I3a0c5e287729ae7fc34f95be1e23995142c0b6fb
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I3a0c5e287729ae7fc34f95be1e23995142c0b6fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-dashboard refs/changes/09/589909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: -c{env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=stable/rocky}

commit_message:
Add DVS utility methods

Provide methods that wil enable nova/neutron to manage port
groups.

Change-Id: I81fc039e86b56388881427a6fbc4efd41207fafa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/17/599217/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 VMware, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging from oslo_concurrency import lockutils from oslo_utils import excutils import six from oslo_vmware._i18n import _ from oslo_vmware.common import loopingcall from oslo_vmware import exceptions from oslo_vmware import pbm from oslo_vmware import vim from oslo_vmware import vim_util LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def get_dvs_moref(value): """Get managed DVS object reference. :param value: value of the DVS managed object :returns: managed object reference with given value and type 'VmwareDistributedVirtualSwitch' """ return vim_util.get_moref(value, 'VmwareDistributedVirtualSwitch') def get_vlan_spec(session, vlan_id): """Gets portgroup vlan spec. :param session: vCenter soap session :param vlan_id: the vlan_id for the port :returns: The configuration when a single vlan_id is used for a port """ # Create the spec for the vlan tag client_factory = session.vim.client.factory spec_ns = 'ns0:VmwareDistributedVirtualSwitchVlanIdSpec' vl_spec = client_factory.create(spec_ns) vl_spec.vlanId = vlan_id vl_spec.inherited = '0' return vl_spec def get_trunk_vlan_spec(session, start=0, end=4094): """Gets portgroup trunk vlan spec. :param session: vCenter soap session :param start: the starting id :param end: then end id :returns: The configuration when a port uses trunk mode. This allows a guest to manage the vlan id. """ client_factory = session.vim.client.factory spec_ns = 'ns0:VmwareDistributedVirtualSwitchTrunkVlanSpec' vlan_id = client_factory.create('ns0:NumericRange') vlan_id.start = start vlan_id.end = end vl_spec = client_factory.create(spec_ns) vl_spec.vlanId = vlan_id vl_spec.inherited = '0' return vl_spec def get_port_group_spec(session, name, vlan_id, trunk_mode=False): """Gets the port configuration for a distributed port group :param session: vCenter soap session :param name: the name of the port group :param vlan_id: vlan_id for the port :param trunk_mode: indicates if the port will have trunk mode or use specific tag above :returns: The configuration for a port group. """ client_factory = session.vim.client.factory pg_spec = client_factory.create('ns0:DVPortgroupConfigSpec') pg_spec.name = name pg_spec.type = 'ephemeral' config = client_factory.create('ns0:VMwareDVSPortSetting') if trunk_mode: config.vlan = get_trunk_vlan_spec(session) elif vlan_id: config.vlan = get_vlan_spec(session, vlan_id) pg_spec.defaultPortConfig = config return pg_spec def add_port_group(session, dvs_moref, name, vlan_id=None, trunk_mode=False): """Add a new port group to the dvs_moref :param session: vCenter soap session :param dvs_moref: managed DVS object reference :param name: the name of the port group :param vlan_id: vlan_id for the port :param trunk_mode: indicates if the port will have trunk mode or use specific tag above :returns: The new portgroup moref """ pg_spec = get_port_group_spec(session, name, vlan_id, trunk_mode=trunk_mode) task = session.invoke_api(session.vim, 'CreateDVPortgroup_Task', dvs_moref, spec=pg_spec) task_info = session.wait_for_task(task) LOG.info("%(name)s create on %(dvs)s with %(value)s.", {'name': name, 'dvs': dvs_moref.value, 'value': task_info.result.value}) return task_info.result def get_portgroups(session, dvs_moref): """Gets all configured portgroups on the dvs_moref :param session: vCenter soap session :param dvs_moref: managed DVS object reference :returns: List of all portgroups on configured DVS """ pgs = [] port_groups = session.invoke_api(vim_util, 'get_object_properties', session.vim, dvs_moref, ['portgroup']) while port_groups: if len(port_groups) and hasattr(port_groups[0], 'propSet'): for prop in port_groups[0].propSet: for val in prop.val[0]: props = session.invoke_api(vim_util, 'get_object_properties', session.vim, val, ['name']) if len(props) and hasattr(props[0], 'propSet'): for prop in props[0].propSet: pgs.append((prop.val, val)) port_groups = session._call_method(vim_util, 'continue_retrieval', port_groups) return pgs def delete_port_group(session, portgroup_moref): """Delete a specific port group :param session: vCenter soap session :param portgroup_moref: managed portgroup object reference :returns: List of all portgroups on configured DVS """ """Delete a specific port group.""" task = session.invoke_api(session.vim, 'Destroy_Task', portgroup_moref) session.wait_for_task(task)
